Flight speed and sensitivity will be substantially increased when you turn off Beginner mode. Fly with caution.

Take Off? Ensure that conditions are safe for takeoff. Aircraft will go to an altitude of %1$s and hover. Positioning failed. The aircraft will automatically fly to %1$s above the ground. Do not take off in a narrow space or near crowd or buildings. Do not touch propellers. Precisely record takeoff point With Precision Takeoff Mode enabled, the aircraft will automatically ascend to %1$s. This allows the aircraft to return to home point more accurately with VPS images. Ensure there is sufficient ambient light and that the takeoff route isn\'t blocked by trees, power lines or other objects. Moving the sticks during takeoff may affect image acquisition. In an emergency, use the control sticks to throttle downward. Slide to Take Off
Land? Aircraft will land at its current location. Check landing area is clear. Slide to Land
Continue Landing? Aircraft has descended to %1$s. Aircraft is hovering low. Ensure the landing point is safe and push the stick downward to land.
Not suitable for landing. Area is not suitable for landing. Please move to a safer location. Slide to Force Landing
Return home and land? Slide to Return Home The distance between the aircraft and Home Point is less than 65.6 ft (20 m). The aircraft will return home at its current altitude if RTH is initiated. The aircraft is less than 20 m (65.6 ft) from the Home Point. The aircraft will land if Return to Home is initiated. Approaching a No-Fly Zone. Current RTH route may be distorted. Monitor the aircraft\'s flight path on the map or visually to ensure safety. Aircraft will head to home point and set RTH route. Use virtual joystick to adjust flight direction. Tap Cancel RTH button to stop RTH. Aircraft will adjust its nose direction to face the home point, and its altitude to %1$s. Current aircraft altitude is %2$s. Press Return to Home button directly on your remote to cancel this procedure, or take over control sticks.
Antenna 1 Antenna 2 Base Station Satellites# GPS: BeiDou: GLONASS: Galileo:
Aircraft Base Station Latitude: %1$.9f %1$.3f %1$.2f Longitude: Ellipsoidal Height: Course Angle: Orientation: Positioning: Standard Deviation: Real-Time Kinematic positioning is based on the phase of the signal\'s carrier phase and outputs centimeter-level 3D positioning on particular coordinates. Heading is determined by the two antennas of the rover.
RTK Positioning When RTK module malfunctions, manually disable RTK and switch back to GPS mode. (If you enable RTK after takeoff, the GPS will continually be used.) Motors are running. Stop them and try again.

Maintain Positioning Accuracy Mode In case of an RTK module communication error, the aircraft will automatically maintain the current RTK status with gradually decreasing accuracy. The aircraft will exit RTK if the connection is not re-established within 10 minutes.
Unlock Unlock %1$s By tapping Unlock, you agree that you have the authorization to operate in this fly zone. A record of this request will be linked to your DJI account. Tap Cancel to abort the operation. Currently unlocked and expires at %1$s Failed to unlock. You are not authorized to unlock this zone. Failed to unlock. %1$s Failed to login. You are not authorized to perform this action. Something went wrong. Failed to login. Please try again later. Warning Enhanced warning Authorized Restricted Self Unlock Custom Unlock In order to unlock fly zones you must login with your DJI account. RTK Coordinates Select RTK Service Type Make sure D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is in open area and do not adjust position after setup. Stop them and try again. Restart aircraft after switching RTK services Make sure D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is in open area and do not adjust position after setup. Check network connection status\n4. Server error. Contact RTK supplier to check server status

Check the following Retry No D-RTK 2 Mobile Stations found 1. Check whether the D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is powered on\n2. Ensure the D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is placed in an open area free of obstructions\n3. Check whether the D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is set in Broadcast mode View D-RTK 2 connection guide Connection failed Request failed. Check and try again
Reset Password Power On Switch Modes Connect to DJI Pilot Press and hold the linking button for 3 seconds while pressing the M button simultaneously. The indicator will blink red several times to indicate that the password has been reset to 123456 Press and hold the power button for 3 seconds. The indicator will display solid green to indicate initialization is complete Press and hold the operating mode button for two seconds until the indicator blinks yellow. Then, press the same button to switch mobile station modes. Go to RTK Settings and select the current D-RTK 2 mobile station. Linking is now complete The device automatically restarts after switching to and from Broadcast mode. Restarting takes around 10s Back Next Complete Replay Reset Success Tap to switch modes Broadcast mode is indicated by the indicator blinking five times in a row

When lighting is sufficient and environment is suitable for vision system to work properly, aircraft will automatically fly to open area, ascend to preset altitude, and fly an optimal RTH route When lighting is sufficient and environment is suitable for vision system to work properly, aircraft will automatically plan an optimal RTH route and altitude. StopPairing StartPairing Linking Complete
Obstacle Avoidance Off When enabled, aircraft will not avoid obstacles Brake When enabled, aircraft will brake when obstacles are detected Avoid When enabled, aircraft will bypass obstacles or hover Brake: Aircraft will automatically brake when obstacles are detected. Enable obstacle avoidance in corresponding directions required Avoid: Aircraft will automatically bypass obstacles or hover when in Normal mode Off: Aircraft will not automatically bypass obstacles or brake. Alerts still received for detected obstacles. Fly with caution When disabled, horizontal, upward, and downward obstacle avoidance are unavailable. Aircraft will not automatically brake when obstacles are detected. Alerts still received for detected obstacles. Continue? Aircraft in %1$s mode. Unable to brake. Switch to N mode Aircraft in %1$s mode. Unable to bypass. Switch to N mode
Battery Left Battery Right Battery Stop motor running before gimbal auto calibration. Link to Aircraft The remote controller cannot be linked when the aircraft motors are spinning. Disabling the Vision Positioning System will have the following effects on the aircraft:\n1. Unable to hover in place at low altitude indoors.\n2. Unable to engage obstacle braking indoors.\n3. Unable to engage landing speed protection. Landing at high speed may damage the aircraft. Pay attention to the landing speed. Detalles Check that aircraft is level and nothing is obstructing the gimbal’s range of motion. begin auto calibration.
RTH Altitude Max Altitude Distance Limit Max Flight Distance Saved successfully Setting failed
Failsafe RTH altitude cannot exceed maximum flight altitude. Failed to set. Input the number in the range Failed to set. Input the number in the range When returning to home from more than 50 m away, the aircraft flies to the pre-set RTH altitude and returns to home. When returning to home from within 50 m of the home point, the aircraft maintains its current altitude and returns to home. If the sensor system is working normally, the aircraft ascends or hovers when obstacles are detected Flight Mode Enable Multiple Flight Mode P (Positioning) Mode - Satellite and Vision Positioning sensors
enabled for precise positioning.\n\nA (Attitude) Mode - Satellite and Vision Positioning sensors disabled. Only
barometer is used for altitude control.\n\nF (Function) Mode - similar to P mode and allows access to
Intelligent Flight Modes.
T/P/S T/S/N A/S/N T/N/S A/P/S A/N/S
Compass IMU Sport (S) Mode - Aircraft mobility and flight speed increases. Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled. \n\nPosition (P) Mode - Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled. \n\nTripod (T) Mode - Max flight speed of 1 m/s. Flight maneuverability is reduced to help fine-tune compositions smoothly. GPS and downward vision positioning systems enabled. Sport (S) Mode - Aircraft mobility and flight speed increases. Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled.\nPosition (P) Mode - Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled.\nAttitude (A) Mode - Forward and Backward Obstacle Sensing, Satellite and Downward Vision Positioning systems disabled. Precise hovering unavailable. Attitude (A) Mode - Forward and Backward Obstacle Sensing, Satellite and Downward Vision Positioning systems disabled. Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled.\nNormal (N) Mode - Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled. Precise hovering unavailable.\nNormal (N) Mode - Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled.\nSport (S) Mode - Aircraft mobility and flight speed increases. Satellite and Vision Positioning systems enabled. Tripod (T) Mode: Max flight speed is limited for smoother shooting while maintaining the positioning settings of P mode.\nPosition (P) Mode: Satellite and downward vision positioning systems enabled.\nSport (S) Mode: Aircraft mobility and flight speed increases. Satellite and downward vision positioning systems enabled. Tripod (T) Mode: Max flight speed is limited for smoother shooting while maintaining the positioning settings of N mode.\n\nSport (S) Mode: Aircraft mobility and flight speed increases. Tripod (T) Mode: Max flight speed is limited for smoother shooting while maintaining the positioning settings of N mode.\n\nSport (S) Mode: Aircraft mobility and flight speed increases. Satellite and downward vision positioning systems enabled.\n\nNormal (N) Mode: Satellite and downward vision positioning systems enabled. Aircraft uses visual orientation instead of compass orientation when the ambient light is good (such as daytime). Interference to the compass can be ignored Signal Lost Action Gimbal %1$s %1$s Camera SN Store at High Battery Level Store at High Battery Level means storing battery when it has 90% or higher battery level. If high battery level storage time in total is less than 120 days in 12 months, battery can be charged for up to 400 cycles. IMU Calibration Start Dismount Propellers first. Follow the instruction and indication to calibrate. Do not move the aircraft unless to overturn the aircraft as indicated. Ensure the aircraft is powered on. Do not start motor. Place the aircraft on dry and plain ground as indicated. Ensure the aircraft is powered on. Do not start motor. IMU Calibration Success Back to Camera View Restart aircraft IMU Calibration Failed. Please retry. No %1$d IMU Calibration error code is %2$d Retry IMU Calibrating. Aircraft cannot work now. Exit now? IMU Calibrating. Please wait.
Home Point Settings Aircraft location set as Home Point Remote controller location set as Home Point Companion controller location set as Home Point PinPoint set as Home Point GNSS signal weak. Unable to obtain location info Failed to set Home Point
Remote Controller Calibration Calibrate Push all sticks throughout their maximum range and repeat several times. Then press Finish to complete the calibration. Start Done Center both control sticks before pressing Start. Follow the prompts on screen to calibrate. Calibrate Move each stick through its complete range of motion several times. Then press Finish to complete calibration. Center both control sticks, then press Start to begin calibration. The last remote controller calibration has been time out, the calibration state will be reset. Setting failed. Check the device connection and retry. Disconnected 1.Stick Calibration: Move the sticks through their entire range of motion repeatedly. 2.Left Dial Calibration: Turn the left dial up to its limit repeatedly. 2.Dial Calibration: Turn the dials up to their limits repeatedly. 3.Lever Calibration: Turn levers up to their limits repeatedly. Tap Calibrate and follow instructions. Remote Controller Calibration Completed Turn the left dial left or right to the as indicated. Repeat for the right dial. Left Dial Calibration Push the stick as indicated. Repeat. Next Power off the aircraft, then calibrate the remote controller. Follow the instructions to proceed. Control Sticks Dial Left Dial Calibration Right Dial Calibration Left Dial Right Dial Move control sticks gently to fill out the square with the ball\'s trajectories. Turn the left and right dials to the maximum repeatedly. Slowly move both control sticks through their entire range of motion
Compass Calibrated. Compass Calibration Failed Calibrating compass. Stay clear of magnets or metal objects. Lift the aircraft to about 1.5 m (4.9 ft) above the ground and rotate for 360°. Calibrating compass. Stay clear of magnets or metal objects. Lift the aircraft to about 1.5 m (4.9 ft) above the ground and rotate for 360° vertically. Rotate the aircraft horizontally for 360° Rotate the aircraft 360° vertically As shown in the figure, hold Arm 3 and 6, and then spin a circle in place. Cancel Calibration Compass Calibration Complete Intensive electromagnetic interference nearby. Ensure no magnets or metal objects are near the compass and keep the aircraft 1 meter above ground for recalibration. The remaining battery is only enough for RTH. Return home now. Cannot calibrate compass while the motors are rotating. Operate Failed ,Please Retry Vision positioning systems help aircraft hover and support landing protection when GPS signal is weak. Disabling downward vision system will disable landing protection
Flying above 120 m (400 ft) may violate local laws and regulations. To ensure flight safety, make sure you understand relevant regulations before flying Flying above 500 m (1,640 ft) may violate local laws and regulations. To ensure flight safety, make sure you understand relevant regulations before flying. Max altitude settings will revert to default after restarting aircraft In this configuration, Tripod (T) mode becomes Attitude (A) mode. The current flight mode is not affected. \n In A mode, the aircraft is easily disturbed and drifts horizontally as a result. Aircraft is unable to hover or engage Active Braking. Control the aircraft to hover manually. When aircraft is farther than 50 m from Home Point, aircraft will automatically calculate RTH route, fly to open area, ascend to preset altitude, and return to home\nWhen aircraft is 5 to 50 m from Home Point, aircraft will fly planned route and return to home at current altitude\nWhen aircraft is less than 5 m from Home Point, aircraft will land automatically\nIf lighting is insufficient or environment is not suitable for vision system to work properly, such as direct sunlight at dusk or weak or no light at night, aircraft will fly to Home Point in straight line at preset altitude Aircraft will automatically calculate optimal RTH route. If lighting is insufficient or environment is not suitable for vision system to work properly, such as direct sunlight at dusk or weak or no light at night, aircraft will fly to Home Point in straight line at preset altitude Turning off the bottom auxiliary light disables the downward vision sensing system when landing in low ambient light. Fly with caution.
